label: Description
value: Sewing case in the form of a pocket book with a metal clasp. Cover of green silk taffeta with embroidery in black silk with beads. LIning of white silk with black feather-stitch.
Design for a Woven Fabric Motif

label: Description
value: Textile design featuring a large paisley motif, also referred to as a Persian cone. Purple roses, with green leaves and stems with small thorns, appear inside the teardrop shape. The teardrop contains a border with a green zig-zag pattern. Red, blue, are dark purple flowers, along with black stems and green leaves, surround the teardrop. Lilacs appear at the bottom of the composition; at top, a rectangular band of purple and red flowers is shown.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on brown oiled translucent paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Design for a Woven Fabric Motif

label: Description
value: Textile design featuring a colorful paisley-like motif containing of an arragement of fantastical floral garlands. The design is outlined in black and contains red, white, yellow, blue, and purple flowers with green leaves. The flowers emerge from a small yellow and purple pedestal.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and gouache on brown oiled translucent paper

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Garden Pavilion and Latticed Gallery with an Alternative Design plate 365 from the publication "L'Art de Treillageur ou menuiserie des jardins"

label: Description
value: Elevation of a domed garden pavilion with an arcaded gallery on either side.  The elevation is split in half and each section shows an alternative design.  The greatest difference is presented in the cupola.  Inscription across the top margin.  Indication of the scale at the lower margin.  Small inscriptions throughout.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Elaborately carved and painted side chair. Back composed of crossed cornucopia, from which spring almost at right angles griffins and heads, holding between them an umbrella shaped canopy, with foliated stem of trumpet flowers, in false Chinese taste; surface is painted in buff, red, green, and blue. The rounded tapering legs curve inwards in the middle but splay out towards the feet; above the finely tapered feet, are carved acanthus leaves. Top of legs have square capitols carved with acanthus leaves and berries.

label: Provenance
value: Countess Costantini; 1924: acquired by the Museum

label: Notes

Design for a Woven or Embroidered Corner Motif

label: Description
value: Fantastical flower arrangement, featuring a bunch of light purple flowers emerging from the center of a red and yellow flower, positioned on top of a group of green, red, yellow, and white leaves. Other flowers and leaves in red, yellow, green, and purple are distributed around the main arrangement.

label: Description
value: Vertical rectangle. All-over pattern of flower-stems and flowers forming framework which encloses bunches of flowers, largely roses, with an occasional single dragon fly. Blue-green field, with naturalistic colors in design.

label: Physical description
value: Block-printed on handmade paper, distemper colors

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council

label: Description
value: Medallion of large shallow bowl, with three feet and link handles, filled with flowers, alternates with scene of woman under an arched lattice playing with a cupid. Framework of ribbon festoons, garlands and scrolls. Printed in reds, greens and blues on a pale blue field. Vertical rectangle.

label: Credit line
value: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
Project for a woven or printed fabric

label: Description
value: Silhouetted boughs in the style of about 1600 hanging from rising waves. Small flower boughs are shown in intervals. An ovoidal is finished.

label: Physical description
value: Blotted black and black crayon, brush and watercolor on paper

label: Description
value: Repeating medallion in brick red and darker red, of figure of a farm boy standing on ground strip amid flowers, flower pots and garden tools, enclosed in draped flouncing of leaf forms edged with lace. Printed on a blue ground.

Design for Four Walls of a Salon

label: Description
value: Elevation of four walls around the floor plan of a salon. Wall 1: fireplace; Wall 3: Windows; Wall 3: center door; wall 4: mirror flanked by pair of doors. Inscribed in pencil at lower margin: Style de Boucher fils - aquarelle XVIIIe siecle, salon Louis XVI - 30L; inscribed in pencil on verso: Dessin de XVIIIe s, interieur XVIIIe siecle - Guerinil - 7e
